spans.text: Opening the door, the temperature difference made Taki pause in surprise.
Maybe it was an illusion, or maybe it was really happening, but she felt that the sudden discomfort from earlier was beginning to brew again.
Her breathing became increasingly rapid, and her heartbeat accelerated, panicking with pain.
Forcing herself to move step by step to the dining table, with her hands gripping the back of the chair, Taki couldn't stand up straight at all.
She gasped for breath, falling to her knees, an unprecedented sense of crisis swept over her, and her intuition told her that she absolutely couldn't just fall asleep like this.
She struggled to take out her phone, but her hands trembled uncontrollably, and she couldn't even swipe to unlock the screen.
The phone slipped from her palm, and her whole body crashed heavily to the ground.
Her drooping eyelids finally covered her eyes. Taki's already blurred vision completely disappeared, and her consciousness spread endlessly in the boundless darkness.
